clinical_study.brief_title: Adherence in Patients Receiving PegIntron and Rebetol for Hepatitis C in Conjunction With a Patient Assistance Program (Study P04206)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Adherence Rate in Patients Receiving PegIntron / Rebetol (Weight Based) for Hepatitis C in Conjunction With a Patient Assistance Program.

brief_summary.textblock: Patients receiving a patient assistance program during therapy for Hepatitis C will be enrolled into this study. All patients will receive PegIntron and Rebetol (according to the label) and the patient assistance program, which includes (1) medications used for treatment (psychiatric medications); (2) other interventions (nurse support); and (3) educational literature. This study will be compared to similar studies from other clinics using various patient support programs for the purpose of designing future comparative phase IV studies.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Because of slow recruitment; Despite the study was started long time ago (Oct 2004), we have not reached the projected number of patients (150 patients)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who complete treatment with PegIntron plus Rebetol therapy for hepatitis C when administered with a patient assistance program.
Average length of treatment for patients receiving a patient assistance program as part of their treatment for hepatitis C with PegIntron plus Rebetol.

arm_group.description: Patients receiving a patient assistance program during therapy for hepatitis C will be enrolled into this study. All patients will receive PegIntron plus Rebetol (according to the label) and the patient assistance program.

intervention.description: Peginterferon alfa-2b and ribavirin will be administered according to the products' labeling.
Peginterferon alfa-2b and ribavirin will be administered according to the products' labeling.

Patient assistance programs will be classified as follows: medications, including psychiatric medications (antidepressants); other interventions, including nurse telephone calls and nurse support in the office: and educational literature about hepatitis C containing information about the disease, mode of transmission, complications, and treatment and treatment drawbacks that will be given to each patient at the start of treatment.
